_header: More than the death nis thing unto me lief
_description:
A roundel by Charles d’Orléans — 21 lines, translated from his French poem (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 34)

BodHerD38.First Lines:
MOre then the deth nys thing vn to me leefSyn recomfort vnto my
                    carful gref…
BodHerD38.Last Lines:
…Al thow from deth y kepe not now astertThowh that he stood
                    ryȝt even here at me sleve
BodHerD38.Note: 8 lines rhyming aabbaaab and 5 lines aabba.
BodHerD38.Editions:
Hausknecht,  Emil. 
             “Vier gedichte von Charles d’Orleans.” 
             Anglia
         17 (1895): 445-7: 446.
Bliss,  Philip. 
             Reliquiae Hearnianae.
         London: J. Russel Smith, 1869: 1.265-6.

BLHar682.First Lines:
MOre then the deth nys thyng vnto me leefSyn recomfort vnto my
                    karfull greef…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…But as a wrecche avaunt y may of smertThat wrongfully my
                    payne is to geef
BLHar682.Note: As written, repeats first words of lines 1-3 at end to indicate going back to first four lines of the roundel.
